PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_EnvironmentalImpactIndicators
PropertySetDef.Definition: Environmental impact indicators are related to a given “functional unit” (ISO 14040 concept). An example of functional unit is a "Double glazing window with PVC frame" and the unit to consider is "one square meter of opening elements filled by this product”. Indicators values are valid for the whole life cycle or only a specific phase (see LifeCyclePhase property). Values of all the indicators are expressed per year according to the expected service life. The first five properties capture the characteristics of the functional unit. The following properties are related to environmental indicators. There is a consensus agreement international for the five one. Last ones are not yet fully and formally agreed at the international level.

PropertyDef.Name: Reference
PropertyDef.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1'), Also referred to as "construction type". It should be provided as an alternative to the name of the "object type", if the software does not support object types and no classification reference to a recognized classification system used.IFC4.3.0.0 DEPRECATION The Reference property is deprecated and shall no longer be used, use attribute Name on the relating type instead.

PropertyDef.Name: FunctionalUnitReference
PropertyDef.Definition: Reference to a database or a classification

PropertyDef.Name: IndicatorsUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: The unit of the quantity the environmental indicators values are related with.

PropertyDef.Name: LifeCyclePhase
PropertyDef.Definition: The whole life cycle or only a given phase from which environmental data are valid.

PropertyDef.Name: TotalPrimaryEnergyConsumptionPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of energy used as defined in ISO21930:2007.

PropertyDef.Name: NonHazardousWastePerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of non hazardous waste generated

PropertyDef.Name: ClimateChangePerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of greenhouse gases emitted calculated in equivalent CO2

PropertyDef.Name: AtmosphericAcidificationPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of gases responsible for the atmospheric acidification calculated in equivalent SO2

PropertyDef.Name: RenewableEnergyConsumptionPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of renewable energy used as defined in ISO21930:2007

PropertyDef.Name: NonRenewableEnergyConsumptionPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of non-renewable energy used as defined in ISO21930:2007

PropertyDef.Name: ResourceDepletionPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of resources used calculated in equivalent antimony

PropertyDef.Name: StratosphericOzoneLayerDestructionPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of gases destroying the stratospheric ozone layer calculated in equivalent CFC-R11

PropertyDef.Name: PhotochemicalOzoneFormationPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of gases creating the photochemical ozone calculated in equivalent ethylene

PropertyDef.Name: EutrophicationPerUnit
PropertyDef.Definition: Quantity of eutrophicating compounds calculated in equivalent PO4
